properties.areaDesc: Douglas; Kanabec; Todd; Morrison; Mille Lacs
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 12:01AM CST until January 15 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS LIKELY ACROSS CENTRAL MINNESOTA AND LIGHT
ICING LIKELY OVER THE INTERSTATE 90 CORRIDOR TODAY...

.Snow will develop this morning across central Minnesota. Two to
four inches of snow is expected for Douglas, Todd, Morrison, Mille
Lacs, and Kanabec counties. Snow will taper off Wednesday
afternoon. In addition, freezing drizzle can be expected this
morning over far southern Minnesota, including the Interstate 90
corridor. A few hundredths of an inch of ice accretion is expected
for Martin, Faribault and Freeborn counties.

Motorists should exercise caution when traveling and allow for
extra time to get to their destination. Please drive slowly and
with caution if roads are slippery.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Douglas, Morrison, Todd, Kanabec and Mille Lacs
Counties.

* WHEN...Until 3 PM CST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. The cold
wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia
if precautions are not taken.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Motorists should exercise caution and allow
extra time when traveling. Please drive slowly and with caution
if roads are slippery.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST WEDNESDAY
